intro: Lepidaploa acutangula, commonly known as the sharp-angled lepidaploa, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Lepidaploa acutangula is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
